item.title: Ten rules for ERP experiments
item.description: Rules In the chapter “Ten Simple Rules for Designing and Interpreting ERP Experiments” of the book Event-Related Potentials: A Methods Handbook, Steven J. Luck proposed ten rules for ERP experiments. Peaks and components are not the same thing. There is nothing special about the point at which the voltage reaches a local maximum or minimum. It is impossible to estimate the time course or peak latency of a latent ERP component by looking at a single ERP waveform â€“ there may be no obvious relationship between the shape of a local part of the waveform and the underlying latent components.
